Title: Minimum of a quadratic form
Content:
If $\bf{A}$ is a real symmetric matrix, we know that it has orthogonal eigenvectors. Now, say we want to find a unit vector $\bf{n}$ that minimizes the form:
$${\bf{n}}^T{\bf{A}}\ {\bf{n}}$$ 
How can one prove that this vector is given by the eigenvector corresponding to the minimum eigenvalue of $\bf{A}$? I have a proof of my own, but it's rather unelegant - how would you go about proving this?
